attributes.action: review the Mayor of London's decision to enlarge the Ultra Low Emission Zone
attributes.additional_details: we feel dis-empowered by the Mayor's unilateral decision to ignore the overwhelming opinion offered to him by the recent 'consultation' to reject his proposal to enlarge the Ultra Low Emission Zone. Although the Mayor was democratically elected  by a majority of the population we believe it is cavalier of him to seek an opinion of his electorate and then to ignore that decision by citing potential health benefits which have little  scientific evidence but is seen as a fund-raising  opportunity.
attributes.background: to restore the democratic rights of the population of Greater London by requiring the Mayor of London to hold a binding referendum on the possibility of enlarging the Ultra Low Emission Zone in a timely manner before any further activity is considered in implementing his unilateral decision

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
